Hi Guys, I have a silver bullet for Hangovers.

Hangover Cure = fast for 48hours at the beginning of the week.

While it is pretty annoying fasting for two days, the effects on hangovers last about a month. (sounds too good to be true, but it really works for me)

In my experience I have noticed a strong correlation between fasting and hangover symptoms being reduced to none. I quite comfortable drink 8 to 10 beers or 2 bottle off red wine. At worst I wake with a dry mouth the next day.

In my case this has been a game changer

Ethanol Harm Reduction Tips from a Psychopharmacologist:
1. For every milliliter of ethanol-containing beverage ingested, drink an equal amount of mL of regular water, e.g. after drinking one 355 mL beer, follow it with 355 mL of water.
2. Do not over-compensate with regular water, e.g. do not drink more than about 750 mL of water per one hour, or else you risk hyponatremia/water-intoxication (which can kill anyone).
3. Do not consume more than one ethanol-containing beverage per one hour, e.g. do not consume more than 45 mL of 40% ABV liquor, or 355 mL of 5% beer, or 150 mL of 12% wine, per hour.
4. Eat a healthy, nutritious, vegetable-containing, fiber-rich, protein-rich, filling meal 30 to 60 minutes prior to ingesting your first ethanol-containing beverage.
5. Eat a small, healthy snack once every two to three hours during the period of time that you are consuming ethanol-containing beverages.
6. Do not wait to urinate, i.e. do not 'hold it in', and after urinating try to ingest a small amount non-alcoholic, but electrolyte-rich fluid, such as 100% pure unsweetened carrot juice.
7. Do not take mega-doses of vitamins or minerals before, during, or after your period of ethanol consumption.
8. One of the only hepatoprotective (liver-protecting) herbal supplements that has a scientifically-verified helpful effect for ethanol-consumers is Milk Thistle extract (Silybum marianum), evidence shows that it may provide beneficial protective effects on the human liver when consumed in recommended dosages before or after heavy ethanol ingestion. However, it is not a cure or magic pill, and it won't guarantee that you won't develop liver, kidney, cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, or neurological diseases from prolonged heavy ethanol consumption, it may only help a little bit.
9. Organic ginger root (Zingiber officinale) in tisane (herbal tea) form may reduce symptoms of a hangover (especially nausea) after a night of drinking, as it has anti-inflammatory, anti-emetic, and antioxidant effects in humans. Scientific evidence for these effects in humans is moderate but, as with Milk Thistle extract, more research is needed to discover the full mechanisms of action.
10. If you consume "hard alcohol", a.k.a. 80-proof (40% ABV) liquor/spirits, make sure to choose some form of vodka (there are wheat-based and potato-based vodkas), if you are in the U.S.A., then anything sold as "vodka" is strictly regulated to contain nothing else but 40% ethanol and 60% water plus tiny fractions of trace fermentation/distillation byproducts. The darker your liquor, the more manufacturing byproducts there are within it, some of which can be more harmful than ethanol itself (e.g. methanol and other carcinogenic toxins).
11. If you travel while under the influence of ethanol, never ever drive a motor vehicle, bicycle, or anything else you can operate that accelerates your body to high speeds. Always arrange for a sober friend or trusted driver to transport you and everyone else with you who have consumed ethanol or plan to that day.
12. Purchase a high-quality "breathalyzer" (breath-analyzer) device and use it on yourself and your friends if you want a decently reliable way to measure your current blood alcohol concentration (BAC), it may be helpful for judging whether or not your driver is safe to operate a vehicle, and can provide you with information to help you better judge whether or not you should continue ingesting ethanol. It may also be helpful for preventing ethanol-poisoning by providing forewarning of elevated BAC.


Be safe, everyone!

I'm no doctor, but I am an avid drinker, and based on my experience a lot of what's said here seems to miss the mark.
Right from the beginning, I've had what felt like hangovers from things like too many energy drinks, or a panic attack, in the absence of alcohol.
A headache is not the definitive symptom of a hangover. I have been e x t r e m e l y hungover and never felt a headache. I have also had excruciating headaches from drinking, but otherwise not feel hungover at all.
Drinking on an empty stomach absolutely makes you more drunk and for longer. But at this point you're misconstruing actually being drunk with the resulting hangover, and you never mention the hangover in relation to this study at all.

Hangover is due to a dehydrated brain. Brain dehydrates when alcohol alters the hormone ADH (anti-diuretic hormone), the reason why you always pee when you are on a drinking session. So I suggest, before going to bed after a good alcohol spree, go drink LOTS of water. This way you’ll somehow prevent your brain from dehydrating thus preventing hangover. Try this and thank me later. 👍👍

In my 18-30ish years I really didn't get hangovers unless I got stupid drunk. By my late 30's I noticed that I did feel poorly the next day after a night of hard drinking. By the time 50 rolled around, a night of hard drinking led to, well, it wasn't pleasant, that's for sure. Now, in my late 50's I don't drink alcohol at all, and really don't miss it.
The 'don't miss it' part has led me to believe that since I wasn't trying to 'drink my sorrows away' I really just drank because I could. I'm glad I stopped before I drank myself into a pine box.
Interesting thing though, alcoholism does not run in my family as best as I can tell. As much as I drank, I guess I was an alcoholic, but never felt I needed a drink, nor was there ever a craving for it. So it seems I was lucky in more ways than one.
Tall glass of water between each drink also helps cut the dehydration side of things

Don't cure a hangover, prevent it.
Before you go to bed drink a tall glass of water twice. Refill the glass. Leave it by your bed, or even better the toilet you are most likely to use. You will have to pee in the middle of the night and drunk sleepy you isn't going to remember to get more water when you have to pee like a fire hose. Drink the glass when you wake up to pee. Refill the glass and put it back by your bed for the morning. Make sure you drink the water BEFORE you make your coffee. Worst case scenario you might need a headache medicine. Eat some carbs. Take a shower. You'll be totally fine.
It is the only thing that works every time. The hangover is essentially caused by dehydration. All the peeing helps get the toxins out of your system. The carbs soak
up any excess alcohol. The shower relaxes your blood vessels and helps any lingering headaches.
I quit drinking several years ago. Absolutely no hangovers!👍☺

I know a bunch of whiskey distillers. They insist the 'congeners' are to blame 100%, and most commercial whiskeys have congeners added for that purpose. A high quality 'pure' ethanol will never cause a hangover.

This video missed the mark:  The reason people get hung over is mostly due to dehydration.  My best tip is to drink lots of water.  The more you drink, the more water you should be drinking.  When your done drinking, before bed, top up on as much water as you can.  The more water you can drink between your drinking and the time you have to get up in the morning, the less of a hangover you will have.  Hydration plays a much larger effect then sleep.  So drink lots of Water and test it for yourself.

This is all hard to measure and study. Self reporting of hangovers is too inaccurate. People with the same symptoms will report two different feelings. People who drink, eat, and smoke the same amount will be affected in different ways. There is no controlled way to get accurate results from a study of this nature.
